thread.title: Jamie Oliver's north London home raided by burglars
thread.title_full: Jamie Oliver's north London home raided by burglars

title: Jamie Oliver's north London home raided by burglars
text:
Jamie Oliver's north London home raided by burglars Jamie Oliver's north London home raided by burglars 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Jamie Oliver’s £7 million north London home has been raided by burglars after a break-in through a garage door. 
Thieves stole thousands of pounds’ worth of jewellery and electronics after breaking through a door adjacent to the property, according to reports. 
The 40-year-old celebrity chef and his wife and children are thought to have been at their Essex home during the raid on October 2. Filming in Southend again This week and dropped in on my uncle Colin and auntie Mary ….Oliver's on… https://t.co/EPJpgQ2gqG 
— Jamie Oliver (@jamieoliver) October 13, 2015 
A spokesman for the Metropolitan Police confirmed the burglary. 
He said: “Police were called to an address on Friday October 2 shortly after 9pm after a member of the public reported that a door to the property was open. 
“Officers attended and went inside the property and found that the premises had been burgled. Items were removed from the address.” (Ian West/PA) 
Jamie’s spokesman played down the break-in, suggesting thieves had only accessed the basement. He added there was ”nothing really to it”. Share article 
Police said no arrests have been made. Promoted Stories
